snippet: From Italy, Greece, Spain and other countries in the euro zone, the affluent are moving money into hard assets valued in something other than euros.
abstract: Affluent investors from various countries in the euro zone are moving money into hard assets valued in something other than euros, which have been plunging in value; prime London real estate has long been an attractive investment, but more buyers from Continental Europe now seem eager for sterling-denominated properties; flight of cash now poses one of the big financial risks for the euro zone.
lead_paragraph: From Italy, Greece, Spain and other countries in the euro zone, the affluent are moving money into hard assets valued in something other than euros.

headline.main: Nervous Europeans Snap Up London Property
headline.print_headline: Worried About Currency, Europeans Are Buying Up London Property
